attributes.action: A new national holiday to remember the sacrifices of NHS during coronavirus
attributes.additional_details: The coronavirus pandemic is the worst disaster to strike our nation since the second world war.  We have all been overwhelmed by the sacrifices that have been made by our NHS workers and others to contain and defeat this virus and fight its effects.  We literally owe them our lives.  In light of this, and in remembrance of those who lost their lives both here and abroad, it feels only right that the government should declare a new national day dedicated to them.
attributes.background: I would like parliament to debate the establishment of a new national day of remembrance or national holiday to recognise the sacrifices of our NHS workers and others during the coronavirus pandemic as well as those who lost their lives during the crisis.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

Move all bank holidays to a time after Coronavirus Lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309243

Bank holiday to thank those who helped during the COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307364

Create a new Bank Holiday in recognition of the NHS and all its amazing workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882

Introduce a 'one off' bank holiday after covid-19 pandemic to boost morale: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304513

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
